intro: Gnaphalium candicans, commonly known as the white feather grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are arranged in dense, feathery clusters. It thrives in dry, sunny conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a notable species in its native habitat.
